page.title: 06ST. MARY'S GOVERNMENT
page.content: POPULATION AND GOVERNMENT. In 1984 there were 19 deaths and 12 births.ON St Mary's there are 13 councillors and 10committees, there are also other smaller committees called sub committees that are less important. These are the names of them there are planning, management, tourism, airport and transport, Social Services, off island committee, Education, Housing, General Services and Sea Fisheries. The council gets its money from the rate payers and the government and from rent. In 1984 they got Â£517000 from the rate payers, Â£980000 from the government and Â£235000 from rent. Â£1750000 of that is spent on Education
